CREATE FUNCTION [ConvertFromLocal_Table](@IN_DATE DATETIME, @TZ_NAME NVARCHAR(50) = NULL) RETURNS @result TABLE( value DATETIME) AS BEGIN IF @IN_DATE IS NULL BEGIN INSERT INTO @result SELECT NULL
RETURN END
IF @TZ_NAME IS NULL SET @TZ_NAME = (SELECT Isnull([VALUE], [DEFAULT_VALUE]) FROM [innovator].[VARIABLE] WHERE [NAME] = 'CorporateTimeZone')
IF @TZ_NAME IS NULL BEGIN DECLARE @NEW_LINE NVARCHAR(2)
SET @NEW_LINE = Char(13) + Char(10)
DECLARE @ERROR_MSG NVARCHAR(256)
SET @ERROR_MSG = @NEW_LINE + @NEW_LINE + 'Error occured during execution of ConvertFromLocal_Table function:' + @NEW_LINE SET @ERROR_MSG = @ERROR_MSG + 'Timezone is not specified for date ''' + CONVERT(NVARCHAR, @IN_DATE, 20) + '''.' + @NEW_LINE + @NEW_LINE SET @ERROR_MSG = @ERROR_MSG + 0 --UDF's does not support RAISERROR function, here is a trick to raise conversion error with a useful message END
INSERT INTO @result SELECT [tz].[ConvertFromLocal](@IN_DATE, @TZ_NAME)
RETURN END
